summary: This is an email chain from March 21, 2019, discussing FBI investigative activities related to Jeffrey Epstein. It indicates agents are poking around, that Epstein may be aware, and references a subject who told the FBI they would 'never find me.' The email also mentions scheduling interviews and planning a follow-up trip.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the likely individual who knows the FBI is investigating or 'poking around.'

connections.description: Colleagues or associates communicating via email about investigative updates and logistics.
Al is involved in communications about the FBI's investigative activities targeting Epstein.

events.title: Email discussion of FBI investigation
events.description: Email correspondence discusses FBI agents' activities, the belief that Epstein is aware of the investigation, and a subject who told the FBI 'never find me.' Also mentions scheduling future interviews.

keyFacts: The email indicates FBI agents were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of March 2019.
A subject of the investigation told the FBI they would 'never find me,' suggesting evasion.
The correspondents believe there is a 95% chance Epstein knows the FBI is 'poking around.'
The email discusses scheduling interviews with at least three individuals and planning a follow-up trip.
